data.title: Old Towns of Djenné
data.text: The Old Towns of Djenn (, ) is an archaeological and urban ensemble located in the city of Djenn, in Mali. It comprises four archaeological sites, namely Djenn-Djeno, Hambarktolo, Kaniana and Tonomba. In 1988, it was inscribed by the UNESCO on the World Heritage list.History.Inhabited since 250 B.C., Djenn became a market centre and an important link in the trans-Saharan gold trade. In the 15th and 16th centuries, it was one of the centres for the propagation of Islam. Its traditional houses, of which nearly 2,000 have survived, are built on hillocks ("toguere") as protection from the seasonal floods.
